page.title: We All Got Out of the Army

revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Album | Name = We All Got Out Of The Army | Type = studio | Artist = [[Robert Pollard]] | Cover = We All Got Out Of The Army.jpg | Released = 2010 | Genre = [[Rock and roll]], [[indie rock]] | Label = Guided by Voices Inc. | Producer = [[Todd Tobias]] | Last album = ''[[Elephant Jokes]]''
(2009) | This album = '''We All Got Out Of The Army'''
(2010) | Next album = ''[[Moses on a Snail]]''
(2010) }} {{Album ratings |rev1 = [[Pitchfork Media]] |rev1score = (7.3/10)[http://pitchfork.com/reviews/albums/13937-we-all-got-out-of-the-army// Pitchfork Media review] }} '''''We All Got Out Of The Army''''' is the 14th full-length solo [[studio album]] released by singer-songwriter [[Robert Pollard]] since 1996. The album was recorded at producer [[Todd Tobias]]'s studio in [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]], and was released in February 2010. Similar to ''Elephant Jokes'' Pollard plays guitar on a few solos on this album. [http://pitchfork.com/reviews/albums/13937-we-all-got-out-of-the-army/ Album Review] [[Pitchfork Media]], February 18 2010 ==Track listing== # "Silk Rotor" # "I Can See" # "Post Hydrate Update" # "Your Rate Will Never Go Up" # "On Top of the Vertigo" # "Red Pyramid" # "Talking Dogs" # "Rice Train" # "Wild Girl" # "I'll Take the Cure" # "Cameo of a Smile" # "Poet Bums" # "How Many Stations" # "His Knighthood Photograph" # "Face Down" # "We All Got Out the Army" # "Faster To Babylon" ==References== {{Reflist}} {{GBV}} [[Category:2010 albums]] [[Category:Robert Pollard albums]] [[Category:Self-released albums]]
